result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

**Address was updated verbally by defendant while signing his bonds.
CASH BOND REDUCED TO $0. SIGNATURE BOND SET.
Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle.

11:18 AM Defendant Joel S. Stigler not in court.  Attorney Peter Wollf on behalf of Atty Ronald James Sonderhouse in court for Joel S. Stigler.  Attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Cases called to address non-monetary condition of bond. 
Court orders the Defendant not to operate a motor vehicle and sets a signature bond of $100 in each case. Any former cash bond set is reduced to $0. 
Defendant has one week to report and sign the signature bonds. If he fails to do so, the Court will order a warrant until he complies.

addressed to: defendant for hearing on 9/14/2022 
Defendant is no longer in custody.
Review hearing on September 14, 2022 at 11:30 am.

to the Court filed by Atty. Bosch re: protective placement.
**Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 9/06/22 - Given this information Mr. Stigler is to be released forthwith; the Court is also setting a review hearing to address non-monetary conditions of bond pursuant to state law. Set for hearing in September as soon as possible. Atty Jimenez is released as the GAL.*
Order on Competency Signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow on 9/01/22

2:03 PM Defendant Joel S Stigler in court.  Attorney Ronald Sonderhouse appeared on behalf of Joel Stigler. Attorney Christiana Jimenez appears as Guardian ad Litem for Joel Stigler. Prosecuting attorney Abbey Nickolie in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Cases called for Review Hearing. 
Cases called for review of doctor's report regarding defendant's competency. 
Both parties agree with the findings in the competency report. Defendant agrees he is not competent. 
The court finds that the Defendant is not competent and is not likely to become competent within the time allowed by law. 
Cases 22CF988 and 22CT735 are now suspended. (21CF1502 was previously suspended.)

Attorney Jimenez advises the court of the defendant's living circumstances and possible paths forward. 
Court reviews status of bonds for cases in suspended status. 
Defendant is released from all conditions of bond. 
Assistant Corporation Counsel Zach Bosch appears in person on behalf of the County. 

Court authorizes the release of all complaints and doctor reports across all cases to corporation counsel. 

Pursuant to sec. 971.14(6)(b), Stats. the Sheriff shall promptly transfer the Defendant to Waukesha Memorial Hospital or other appropriate protective placement facility for evaluation under sec. 55.135, Stats. The Court will sign an appropriate order forthwith.
Order for Transport Signed by Judge Dorow on 9/01/22*

ADDRESS INFO for Joel S. Stigler
Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, C/O Waukesha Co Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 06-13-2022)
Prior: 352 Wisconsin Ave,#4, Waukesha, WI 53186
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.

02:01 PM Defendant Joel S. Stigler in court, in custody, with attorney Cassandra A Miller and Attorney Ronald Sonderhouse.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Attorney Miller moves to dismiss Count 1.  For reasons stated on the record, the Court will deny Attorney Miller's motion.  The Court goes over the recently filed letter from Corporation Counsel.  Pursuant to the Trial Court, the Court is ordering a GAL to determine how to move forward.  DEFENSE COUNSEL REQUESTS ORDER FOR COMPETENCY PURSUANT TO SEC.. 971.14(2).  Court grants request and orders the defendant be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  To be done as an outpatient basis within 30 days.  The defendant is to remain in custody until the evaluation is completed.  The Court will set a status before the Trial Court to review whether a GAL has been appointed as well as set a review on competency.  Status conference scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.  Review hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 10:30 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
